titles: A subpæna from the high imperiall court of heauen to bee serued vpon all men: vpon an information preferred by iustice against man-kinde. With the answer, and reply from Mercie, and her directions how to come to heauen, if we auoyd sinne. Shrinke not from this subpæna, which is pend; esteeme it well, for sure thou must appeare ... oh sinner, learne to seeke for thy saluation, if thou in heauen wouldst haue eternall ioyes.
author: Andrewes, John, fl. 1615.
notes: By John Andrewes, whose name appears in an acrostic in the title page verses, reading up.
Identified as STC 23419 on UMI microfilm.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
